PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

* `reverse_search`
   * Description: Performs a reverse image search to find similar images on the web.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will perform a reverse search to find similar images.
   * Format: reverse_search(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealandâ€™s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

# Example: reverse_search()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a rare event of a solar eclipse with a double ring."

...

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:k>)
```

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:56> This image shows Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu inside his office and was captured and published by Hezbollah in August 2024."

# Your Actions



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
```
reverse_search(<image:56>)
```
_________________________



SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:56> This image shows Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu inside his office and was captured and published by Hezbollah in August 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:56>)
```

# Search Result
From [Source](https://pesacheck.org/altered-this-photo-of-a-drone-surveilling-pm-netanyahu-is-fabricated-396f43e817da): Found exact image on website with title: ALTERED: This photo of a drone surveilling PM Netanyahu is ...

ALTERED: This photo of a drone surveilling PM Netanyahu is fabricated
=====================================================================

**The authentic photo of the Israeli PM Netanyahu is from 2009.**
-----------------------------------------------------------------

Listen

Share

A [photo published on X](https://archive.is/0PvDl)
 (formerly Twitter) claiming to show Israeli Prime Minister (PM) Benjamin Netanyahu being surveilled by Iran from inside his office is ALTERED.

The post alleges that Iranâ€™s Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) captured and published the image, accompanied by a warning reading, â€œDo not test our capabilities â€” we intend to keep you living in a state of constant anxiety!â€

However, a reverse image search revealed that the photo has [been online](https://archive.is/JmjZG)
 since 2019 and was not shared by IRGC in 2025, as the post claims.

Furthermore, a Yandex image search showed that the photo was [edited](https://www.malumatfurus.org/netanyahu-makam-odasi/)
 to make it appear as though Netanyahu was under surveillance. The [original image](https://www.gettyimages.com/detail/news-photo/in-this-handout-photo-benjamin-netanyahu-head-of-the-right-news-photo/84719768?adppopup=true)
, taken on 8 February 2009, in Jerusalem, shows Netanyahu with his father, Ben Zion Netanyahu.

A FotoForensics Error Level Analysis (ELA) reveals that the photo has been altered, as indicated by inconsistencies and noise in the image.

PesaCheck has looked into a photo on X (formerly Twitter) claiming to show Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu being surveilled by Iran from inside his office and finds it to have been ALTERED.

_This post is part of an ongoing series of PesaCheck fact-checks examining content marked as_ **_potential misinformation_** _on Facebook and other social media platforms._

[_By partnering with Facebook and similar social media platforms_](/pesacheck-and-facebook-partner-to-fight-misinformation-in-kenya-d6a45ee70c18?gi=d2cb1ae7440)
_, third-party fact-checking organisations like PesaCheck are helping to sort fact from fiction. We do this by giving the public deeper insight and context to posts they see in their social media feeds._

_Have you spotted what you think is fake or false information on Facebook?_ [_Hereâ€™s how you can report_](https://www.facebook.com/help/572838089565953?helpref=faq_content)
_. And,_ [_hereâ€™s_](/our-methodology-f3d77521a1ee)
 _more information on_ [_PesaCheckâ€™s methodology_](/our-methodology-f3d77521a1ee)
 _for fact-checking questionable content._

_This fact-check was written by Senior PesaCheck fact-checker_ [**_Pius Enywaru_**](https://www.linkedin.com/in/enywaru/)
 _and edited by PesaCheck copy editor_ [**_Paul Tajuba_**](https://www.linkedin.com/in/paul-tajuba-93b62a82/)
 _and_ _chief copy editor_ [**_Stephen Ndegwa_**](https://www.linkedin.com/in/stephen-ndegwa-0b32b126b/)
**_._**

_The article was approved for publication by PesaCheck managing editor_ [**_Doreen Wainainah_**](https://twitter.com/DoreenWainainah)
**_._**

_PesaCheck is East Africaâ€™s first public finance fact-checking initiative. It was co-founded by_ [**_Catherine Gicheru_**](https://www.icfj.org/our-work/knight/profiles/catherine-gicheru)
 _and_ [**_Justin Arenstein_**](https://www.icfj.org/our-work/knight/profiles/justin-arenstein)
_, and is being incubated by the continentâ€™s largest civic technology and data journalism accelerator:_ [**_Code for Africa_**](https://codeforafrica.org/)
_. It seeks to help the public separate fact from fiction in public pronouncements about the numbers that shape our world, with a special emphasis on pronouncements about public finances that shape governmentâ€™s delivery of Sustainable Development Goals (SDG) public services, such as healthcare, rural development and access to water / sanitation._ [**_PesaCheck_**](https://pesacheck.org/)
 _also tests the accuracy of media reportage. To find out more about the project, visit_ [**_pesacheck.org_**](https://pesacheck.org/)
_._

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The search result from PesaCheck states that the image <image:56> is fabricated. The original photo was taken in 2009 and shows Benjamin Netanyahu with his father. The article was published 1 day ago.

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:56> This image shows Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu inside his office and was captured and published by Hezbollah in August 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:56>)
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `reverse_search`
From [Source](https://pesacheck.org/altered-this-photo-of-a-drone-surveilling-pm-netanyahu-is-fabricated-396f43e817da): Found exact image on website with title: ALTERED: This photo of a drone surveilling PM Netanyahu is ...
Content: The search result from PesaCheck states that the image <image:56> is fabricated. The original photo was taken in 2009 and shows Benjamin Netanyahu with his father. The article was published 1 day ago.


# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image is fabricated. The original photo was taken in 2009 and shows Benjamin Netanyahu with his father.

_________________________



JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:56> This image shows Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu inside his office and was captured and published by Hezbollah in August 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:56>)
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `reverse_search`
From [Source](https://pesacheck.org/altered-this-photo-of-a-drone-surveilling-pm-netanyahu-is-fabricated-396f43e817da): Found exact image on website with title: ALTERED: This photo of a drone surveilling PM Netanyahu is ...
Content: The search result from PesaCheck states that the image <image:56> is fabricated. The original photo was taken in 2009 and shows Benjamin Netanyahu with his father. The article was published 1 day ago.


## Elaboration
The image is fabricated. The original photo was taken in 2009 and shows Benjamin Netanyahu with his father.


# Your Judgement



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image is fabricated. The original photo was taken in 2009 and shows Benjamin Netanyahu with his father. The claim that the image shows Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu inside his office and was captured and published by Hezbollah in August 2024 is therefore false. `false`
_________________________



SummarizeDocPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You are provided with the record of a fact-check. It contains the Claim to be verified and a documentation of all the fact-checking work along the gathered evidence. Your task is to **summarize the fact-check**. That is, you provide a concise, one-paragraph justification for the final VERDICT based on the knowledge from the Record. Note:
* Be truthful, brief, do not add any additional information besides the information given in the Record. 
* Link key sources in your summary. Use Markdown notation for that. You may link them in-line.
* Don't state the Claim again. Rather focus on the key insights of the fact-check.
* Simply print just the summary.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:56> This image shows Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu inside his office and was captured and published by Hezbollah in August 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:56>)
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `reverse_search`
From [Source](https://pesacheck.org/altered-this-photo-of-a-drone-surveilling-pm-netanyahu-is-fabricated-396f43e817da): Found exact image on website with title: ALTERED: This photo of a drone surveilling PM Netanyahu is ...
Content: The search result from PesaCheck states that the image <image:56> is fabricated. The original photo was taken in 2009 and shows Benjamin Netanyahu with his father. The article was published 1 day ago.


## Elaboration
The image is fabricated. The original photo was taken in 2009 and shows Benjamin Netanyahu with his father.


## Final Judgement
The image is fabricated. The original photo was taken in 2009 and shows Benjamin Netanyahu with his father. The claim that the image shows Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu inside his office and was captured and published by Hezbollah in August 2024 is therefore false. `false`

## Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image depicting Benjamin Netanyahu was fabricated, as confirmed by a reverse image search. The original photo, taken in 2009, shows Netanyahu with his father, thus disproving the claim that the image was captured and published by Hezbollah in August 2024, as reported by [PesaCheck](https://pesacheck.org/altered-this-photo-of-a-drone-surveilling-pm-netanyahu-is-fabricated-396f43e817da).

_________________________



PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

* `reverse_search`
   * Description: Performs a reverse image search to find similar images on the web.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will perform a reverse search to find similar images.
   * Format: reverse_search(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealandâ€™s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

# Example: reverse_search()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a rare event of a solar eclipse with a double ring."

...

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:k>)
```

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:57> This is an authentic image of Esmail Qaani, the commander of the Iranian Revolutionary Guards, disguised in a hijab in fear of Israeli bombing."

# Your Actions



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
```
reverse_search(<image:57>)
web_search("Esmail Qaani disguised hijab")
```

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:57> This is an authentic image of Esmail Qaani, the commander of the Iranian Revolutionary Guards, disguised in a hijab in fear of Israeli bombing."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:57>)
web_search("Esmail Qaani disguised hijab")
```

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The search result is from Nairaland, a Nigerian forum. It discusses an image of Esmail Qaani, the commander of the Iranian Revolutionary Guards, in disguise. The post references an X post by @MOSSADil, which juxtaposes two images of Qaani, one in military attire and another in civilian disguise, suggesting an escape tactic following reported Israeli airstrikes in June 2025. The post also mentions that The New York Times claimed Qaani was killed, but his reappearance challenges that narrative. <image:57> is included in the post.

* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)

* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

**Esmail Qaani** (also rendered as **Ismail Qaani**; [Persian](/wiki/Persian_language "Persian language")
: Ø§Ø³Ù…Ø§Ø¹ÛŒÙ„ Ù‚Ø§Ø¢Ù†ÛŒ, [romanized](/wiki/Romanization_of_Persian "Romanization of Persian")
:Â _EsmÄÊ¾il QÄÊ¾ÄnÄ«_;â€Ž 8 August 1957)[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)
 is an Iranian [brigadier general](/wiki/Brigadier_general "Brigadier general")
 in the [Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps](/wiki/Islamic_Revolutionary_Guard_Corps "Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps")
 (IRGC) who serves as the commander of the IRGC [Quds Force](/wiki/Quds_Force "Quds Force")
, an elite [special operations force](/wiki/Special_forces "Special forces")
 responsible for [extraterritorial operations](/wiki/Extraterritorial_operations "Extraterritorial operations")
. According to _The Sun_, Qaani was allegedly placed under house arrest and interrogated on accusations of being an Israeli spy.[\[33\]](#cite_note-33)
[\[34\]](#cite_note-34)

### Renewed tensions with Israel and US

In the lead up to the [Iranâ€“Israel war](/wiki/Iran%E2%80%93Israel_war "Iranâ€“Israel war")
, Qaani strongly criticised Trump and the US assuring that Iran is ready and prepared for any military aggression.[\[35\]](#cite_note-35)

Reported death
--------------

In June 2025, _The New York Times_ reported via Iranian state media and officials that Esmail Qaani, among others, had been killed in Israeli airstrikes conducted during the early stages of the [2025 Iranâ€“Israel war](/wiki/2025_Iran%E2%80%93Israel_war "2025 Iranâ€“Israel war")
.[\[36\]](#cite_note-36)
 The [Israel Defense Forces](/wiki/Israel_Defense_Forces "Israel Defense Forces")
 did not claim responsibility for targeting him, and Iranian authorities issued no confirmation regarding his status.\[_[citation needed](/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed "Wikipedia:Citation needed")\
_\]

This was not the first instance of unverified reports concerning Qaani's death. ^ [_**a**_](#cite_ref-leading_Iran's_elite_4-0)
     [_**b**_](#cite_ref-leading_Iran's_elite_4-1)
     [_**c**_](#cite_ref-leading_Iran's_elite_4-2)

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The search result is a Wikipedia article about Esmail Qaani, the commander of the Iranian Revolutionary Guards' Quds Force. It mentions that Qaani was born in 1957 and has been in the IRGC since 1980. The article also mentions that Qaani has been criticized Trump and the US. The article also mentions unverified reports concerning Qaani's death. <image:i>

At the time of his visit to Bamiyan, Qaani was serving as the deputy commander of the Quds Force under Soleimani.

**Why the visit?**

Afghan officials say that Qaani never served in a diplomatic capacity in Afghanistan, raising questions about the intentions of his visit to the predominately Shiite province in central Afghanistan.

â€œWe are investigating the exact nature and date of his visit. At this point I can assure you that he was never the deputy ambassador in Afghanistan,â€ Idrees Zaman, Afghanistanâ€™s acting foreign minister, said in a press conference Tuesday.

Some Afghanistan analysts like Jonathan Schroden, the director of Center for Stability and Development at Washington-based research and analysis organization CNA, are charging that Iran might have arranged for the alleged disguise to prevent the Afghan governmentâ€™s monitoring.

â€œIt is hard to say whether he was actually traveling under a false title in this case; itâ€™s possible that Iran could have named him as a DCM, if even temporarily, in whatever travel documents he had, etc., in order to provide him official cover for his travel,â€ Schroden said.

He however expressed some skepticism over the alleged disguise, saying it is unlikely that Iranâ€™s commander could hide behind a bogus identity given his high-profile status for years in Iran and the wider region.

**Recruitment**

Other experts say Qaaniâ€™s visit could be seen as an effort to mobilize Shiite people to support the Quds Force, given Iranâ€™s previous efforts to gain influence among Shiites in Afghanistan.

Regional experts say it was Qaaniâ€™s duty to actively recruit for the Quds Force among Shia populations in Afghanistan.

Farzin Nadimi, an associate fellow with the Washington Institute for Near East Policy, told VOA that one of Iranâ€™s main targets has been to establish a foothold in the Shiite areas in Afghanistan and Pakistan.

He added that it is generally believed that â€œhis \[Soleimani\] deputy, Gen."

JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.

PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

# Example: web_search()

Text: "New Zealandâ€™s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

...

```

The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:57> This is an authentic image of Esmail Qaani, the commander of the Iranian Revolutionary Guards, disguised in a hijab in fear of Israeli bombing."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:57>)
web_search("Esmail Qaani disguised hijab")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `reverse_search`
From [Source](https://www.nairaland.com/8460455/commander-ghost-qaanis-great-escape): Found exact image on website with title: "From Commander To Ghost: Qaani's Great Escape?" - Foreign Affairs
Content: The search result is from Nairaland, a Nigerian forum. It discusses an image of Esmail Qaani, the commander of the Iranian Revolutionary Guards, in disguise. The post references an X post by @MOSSADil, which juxtaposes two images of Qaani, one in military attire and another in civilian disguise, suggesting an escape tactic following reported Israeli airstrikes in June 2025. The post also mentions that The New York Times claimed Qaani was killed, but his reappearance challenges that narrative. <image:57> is included in the post.


### Evidence from `web_search`
The search results include a Wikipedia article about Esmail Qaani, the commander of the Iranian Revolutionary Guards' Quds Force, and mentions criticism from Trump and the US. The article also mentions unverified reports concerning Qaani's death. (<image:i>) [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Esmail_Qaani](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Esmail_Qaani)

Another source from journalist.net lists journalists who cover Esmail Qaani. (<image:12902>) [https://journalist.net/journalists/by-people/esmail-qaani](https://journalist.net/journalists/by-people/esmail-qaani)

A Voice of America (VOA) article discusses Esmail Qaani's visit to Bamiyan province in Afghanistan in 2018, where he introduced himself as an Iranian diplomat. The article includes a photo of Qaani. (<image:57>) [https://www.voanews.com/a/extremism-watch_afghan-officials-irans-new-quds-chief-likely-faked-identity-2018/6182322.html](https://www.voanews.com/a/extremism-watch_afghan-officials-irans-new-quds-chief-likely-faked-identity-2018/6182322.html)


## Elaboration
The evidence suggests that the image is associated with Esmail Qaani, the commander of the Iranian Revolutionary Guards. The image appears on a Nigerian forum, which discusses Qaani's disguise. A VOA article mentions Qaani using a fake identity. The evidence does not explicitly confirm the image's authenticity or the reason for the disguise.

The claim is partially supported by the evidence, as it identifies Qaani in the image. However, the reason for the disguise, as stated in the claim, is not directly confirmed by the evidence.

Insufficient information to verify the claim.


## Actions
```
image_search("Esmail Qaani hijab disguise")
```

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.

* Be truthful, brief, do not add any additional information besides the information given in the Record. 
* Link key sources in your summary. Use Markdown notation for that. You may link them in-line.
* Don't state the Claim again. Rather focus on the key insights of the fact-check.

PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

* `reverse_search`
   * Description: Performs a reverse image search to find similar images on the web.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will perform a reverse search to find similar images.
   * Format: reverse_search(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealandâ€™s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

# Example: reverse_search()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a rare event of a solar eclipse with a double ring."

...

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:k>)
```

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "An Algerian judo athlete withdrew from his Olympics 2024 match against an Israeli opponent."

# Your Actions



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
```
web_search("Algerian judo athlete withdraws Olympics 2024 Israeli opponent")
```
_________________________

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.espn.com/olympics/story/_/id/40680600/judo-org-probe-failed-weigh-match): 
Content: "<image:2326>
    
    [Emily Kaplan](https://www.espn.com/contributor/emily-kaplan)
    Jul 30, 2024, 10:36 AM ET
    

*   [!Copy Link <image:2327>](#)
    
*   [Email](mailto:?subject=Judo%20group%20looking%20into%20failed%20weigh%2Din%20for%20match%20vs.%20Israeli&body=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.espn.com%2Folympics%2Fstory%2F_%2Fid%2F40680600)
    
*   [Print](https://www.espn.com/espn/print?id=40680600)
    

Open Extended Reactions

PARIS -- The International Judo Federation will launch an investigation into why Algeria's Messaoud Redouane Dris failed his weigh-in before a bout with Israel's Tohar Butbul -- which could be part of a pattern of sportsmanship issues.

An IJF spokesperson told ESPN those questions would be answered in due time. "Unfortunately, athletes often become victims of broader political disputes which are against the values of sport."

The Algerian federation did not immediately respond to comment when contacted by ESPN.

"I think the Algerian athletes and all the Muslim athletes cannot go to the fight with Israeli athletes," Butbul told reporters. At the Tokyo Olympics in 2021, four judoka athletes failed weigh-ins. Of Israel's 88 athletes at the Olympics, 12 compete in judo. Dris' disqualification marked the third time an opponent has not faced Butbul over the past two Olympics.

"We believe that sport should remain a realm of integrity and fairness, free from the influences of international conflicts," the IJF said in a statement. However, this isn't the first incident involving controversy and Israeli athletes in the sport. On Sunday, both Abderrahmane Boushita of Morocco and Nurali Emomali of Tajikistan refused to shake the hand of Israel's Baruch Shmailov in the under-66kg event.

In Tokyo, another Algerian, Fethi Nourine withdrew from the Olympics to avoid a potential fight against Butbul in the second round. However French President Emmanuel Macron said ahead of the Games that Israeli athletes were welcome in France, and the interior minister ordered increased 24-hour security for the Israeli Olympians days before the opening ceremony. The investigation is expected to take place at the conclusion of the Olympics, and the federation said further action will be taken if needed. They won't let them compete, even though they are athletes."

# Your Summary

ESPN, published on July 30, 2024, reports that the International Judo Federation will investigate why Algeria's Messaoud Redouane Dris failed his weigh-in before a bout with Israel's Tohar Butbul. <image:2326>. The article mentions that Dris' disqualification marked the third time an opponent has not faced Butbul over the past two Olympics. The article also mentions that in Tokyo, another Algerian, Fethi Nourine withdrew from the Olympics to avoid a potential fight against Butbul.

The bout was Butbulâ€™s third walkover victory in the past two Olympics, including two against Algerian opponents. Israelâ€™s presence at the Paris Games has been protested at various points since the beginning of Israelâ€™s offensive in Gaza last year, but the IOC and Franceâ€™s government have firmly backed Israelâ€™s right to participate.

Israel has one of the biggest judo teams at the Paris Games with 12 participants, and four Israeli judokas competed in the first two days of the tournament at Arena Champ-de-Mars.

Although none of their opponents avoided Israelâ€™s first four judokas, Abderrahmane Boushita of Morocco and Nurali Emomali of Tajikistan both refused to shake the hand of Israelâ€™s Baruch Shmailov following their bouts Sunday. â€œUnfortunately, athletes often become victims of broader political disputes which are against the values of sport.â€

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The Associated Press reports that the International Judo Federation will investigate after Algerian judo athlete Messaoud Dris missed weight, preventing a match against Israeli Tohar Butbul at the Paris Games. <image:1>. The article mentions that the bout was highly anticipated due to its political implications. The IJF stated that athletes missing weight is not unusual, but a full review will be conducted. The article also mentions that Butbul has had three walkover victories in the past two Olympics, including two against Algerian opponents. The article also mentions that in the Tokyo Olympics, Algeriaâ€™s Fethi Nourine withdrew to avoid a potential matchup with Butbul. The author is Greg Beacham.

SummarizeSummariesPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved web sources, each one summarized under "Web Sources". **Your task right now is to summarize the web source summaries.**

Always adhere to the following rules:
* Write only one to two paragraphs.
* Include all URLs from the listed sources. Format them as Markdown hyperlinks.
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the summaries.
* Include references (<image:k>) to all relevant images.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "An Algerian judo athlete withdrew from his Olympics 2024 match against an Israeli opponent."

## Actions
```
web_search("Algerian judo athlete withdraws Olympics 2024 Israeli opponent")
```

## Web Sources
**Web Search Result**

From [Source](https://www.espn.com/olympics/story/_/id/40680600/judo-org-probe-failed-weigh-match): 
Content: ESPN, published on July 30, 2024, reports that the International Judo Federation will investigate why Algeria's Messaoud Redouane Dris failed his weigh-in before a bout with Israel's Tohar Butbul. <image:2326>. The article mentions that Dris' disqualification marked the third time an opponent has not faced Butbul over the past two Olympics. The article also mentions that in Tokyo, another Algerian, Fethi Nourine withdrew from the Olympics to avoid a potential fight against Butbul.


From [Source](https://www.theguardian.com/sport/article/2024/jul/29/algerian-judoka-investigated-after-failing-to-make-weight-for-bout-with-israeli): 
Content: The Guardian published an article on July 29, 2024, stating that the International Judo Federation (IJF) is investigating why Algerian judoka Messaoud Redouane Dris failed to make weight for his bout with Israeli Tohar Butbul at the Paris Olympics. The article mentions that an Algerian newspaper hailed the judoka for "smartly avoiding meeting \[the] Israeli opponent by failing to make the weight". <image:i>


From [Source](https://apnews.com/article/olympics-2024-israel-algeria-5925a924c57c1d6440b2cbf09d57cb75): 
Content: The Associated Press reports that the International Judo Federation will investigate after Algerian judo athlete Messaoud Dris missed weight, preventing a match against Israeli Tohar Butbul at the Paris Games. <image:1>. The article mentions that the bout was highly anticipated due to its political implications. The IJF stated that athletes missing weight is not unusual, but a full review will be conducted. The article also mentions that Butbul has had three walkover victories in the past two Olympics, including two against Algerian opponents. The article also mentions that in the Tokyo Olympics, Algeriaâ€™s Fethi Nourine withdrew to avoid a potential matchup with Butbul. The author is Greg Beacham.


## Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The International Judo Federation is investigating why Algerian judoka Messaoud Redouane Dris failed to make weight, preventing a match against Israeli Tohar Butbul at the Paris Olympics, according to reports from ESPN ([https://www.espn.com/olympics/story/_/id/40680600/judo-org-probe-failed-weigh-match](https://www.espn.com/olympics/story/_/id/40680600/judo-org-probe-failed-weigh-match)) and The Guardian ([https://www.theguardian.com/sport/article/2024/jul/29/algerian-judoka-investigated-after-failing-to-make-weight-for-bout-with-israeli](https://www.theguardian.com/sport/article/2024/jul/29/algerian-judoka-investigated-after-failing-to-make-weight-for-bout-with-israeli)) and the Associated Press ([https://apnews.com/article/olympics-2024-israel-algeria-5925a924c57c1d6440b2cbf09d57cb75](https://apnews.com/article/olympics-2024-israel-algeria-5925a924c57c1d6440b2cbf09d57cb75)). The article from ESPN mentions that this is the third time an opponent has not faced Butbul in the last two Olympics. The article from the Associated Press also mentions that in the Tokyo Olympics, Fethi Nourine withdrew to avoid a potential matchup with Butbul. <image:2326> <image:i> <image:1>

_________________________



DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "An Algerian judo athlete withdrew from his Olympics 2024 match against an Israeli opponent."

## Actions
```
web_search("Algerian judo athlete withdraws Olympics 2024 Israeli opponent")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The International Judo Federation is investigating why Algerian judoka Messaoud Redouane Dris failed to make weight, preventing a match against Israeli Tohar Butbul at the Paris Olympics, according to reports from ESPN ([https://www.espn.com/olympics/story/_/id/40680600/judo-org-probe-failed-weigh-match](https://www.espn.com/olympics/story/_/id/40680600/judo-org-probe-failed-weigh-match)) and The Guardian ([https://www.theguardian.com/sport/article/2024/jul/29/algerian-judoka-investigated-after-failing-to-make-weight-for-bout-with-israeli](https://www.theguardian.com/sport/article/2024/jul/29/algerian-judoka-investigated-after-failing-to-make-weight-for-bout-with-israeli)) and the Associated Press ([https://apnews.com/article/olympics-2024-israel-algeria-5925a924c57c1d6440b2cbf09d57cb75](https://apnews.com/article/olympics-2024-israel-algeria-5925a924c57c1d6440b2cbf09d57cb75)). The article from ESPN mentions that this is the third time an opponent has not faced Butbul in the last two Olympics. The article from the Associated Press also mentions that in the Tokyo Olympics, Fethi Nourine withdrew to avoid a potential matchup with Butbul. <image:2326> <image:i> <image:1>


# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The evidence indicates that Algerian judoka Messaoud Redouane Dris did not compete against Israeli Tohar Butbul at the Paris Olympics because he failed to make weight. The International Judo Federation is investigating the situation.

The evidence also mentions that this is not the first time an Algerian judoka has avoided a match with Butbul. In the Tokyo Olympics, Fethi Nourine withdrew to avoid a potential matchup with Butbul.

_________________________



JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "An Algerian judo athlete withdrew from his Olympics 2024 match against an Israeli opponent."

## Actions
```
web_search("Algerian judo athlete withdraws Olympics 2024 Israeli opponent")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The International Judo Federation is investigating why Algerian judoka Messaoud Redouane Dris failed to make weight, preventing a match against Israeli Tohar Butbul at the Paris Olympics, according to reports from ESPN ([https://www.espn.com/olympics/story/_/id/40680600/judo-org-probe-failed-weigh-match](https://www.espn.com/olympics/story/_/id/40680600/judo-org-probe-failed-weigh-match)) and The Guardian ([https://www.theguardian.com/sport/article/2024/jul/29/algerian-judoka-investigated-after-failing-to-make-weight-for-bout-with-israeli](https://www.theguardian.com/sport/article/2024/jul/29/algerian-judoka-investigated-after-failing-to-make-weight-for-bout-with-israeli)) and the Associated Press ([https://apnews.com/article/olympics-2024-israel-algeria-5925a924c57c1d6440b2cbf09d57cb75](https://apnews.com/article/olympics-2024-israel-algeria-5925a924c57c1d6440b2cbf09d57cb75)). The article from ESPN mentions that this is the third time an opponent has not faced Butbul in the last two Olympics. The article from the Associated Press also mentions that in the Tokyo Olympics, Fethi Nourine withdrew to avoid a potential matchup with Butbul. <image:2326> <image:i> <image:1>


## Elaboration
The evidence indicates that Algerian judoka Messaoud Redouane Dris did not compete against Israeli Tohar Butbul at the Paris Olympics because he failed to make weight. The International Judo Federation is investigating the situation.

The evidence also mentions that this is not the first time an Algerian judoka has avoided a match with Butbul. In the Tokyo Olympics, Fethi Nourine withdrew to avoid a potential matchup with Butbul.


# Your Judgement



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The evidence confirms that an Algerian judoka, Messaoud Redouane Dris, did not compete against an Israeli opponent, Tohar Butbul, at the Paris Olympics. The reason given was that Dris failed to make weight, and the International Judo Federation is investigating. This is not the first time an Algerian judoka has withdrawn to avoid a match with an Israeli opponent.

`true`

_________________________



SummarizeDocPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You are provided with the record of a fact-check. It contains the Claim to be verified and a documentation of all the fact-checking work along the gathered evidence. Your task is to **summarize the fact-check**. That is, you provide a concise, one-paragraph justification for the final VERDICT based on the knowledge from the Record. Note:
* Be truthful, brief, do not add any additional information besides the information given in the Record. 
* Link key sources in your summary. Use Markdown notation for that. You may link them in-line.
* Don't state the Claim again. Rather focus on the key insights of the fact-check.
* Simply print just the summary.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "An Algerian judo athlete withdrew from his Olympics 2024 match against an Israeli opponent."

## Actions
```
web_search("Algerian judo athlete withdraws Olympics 2024 Israeli opponent")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The International Judo Federation is investigating why Algerian judoka Messaoud Redouane Dris failed to make weight, preventing a match against Israeli Tohar Butbul at the Paris Olympics, according to reports from ESPN ([https://www.espn.com/olympics/story/_/id/40680600/judo-org-probe-failed-weigh-match](https://www.espn.com/olympics/story/_/id/40680600/judo-org-probe-failed-weigh-match)) and The Guardian ([https://www.theguardian.com/sport/article/2024/jul/29/algerian-judoka-investigated-after-failing-to-make-weight-for-bout-with-israeli](https://www.theguardian.com/sport/article/2024/jul/29/algerian-judoka-investigated-after-failing-to-make-weight-for-bout-with-israeli)) and the Associated Press ([https://apnews.com/article/olympics-2024-israel-algeria-5925a924c57c1d6440b2cbf09d57cb75](https://apnews.com/article/olympics-2024-israel-algeria-5925a924c57c1d6440b2cbf09d57cb75)). The article from ESPN mentions that this is the third time an opponent has not faced Butbul in the last two Olympics. The article from the Associated Press also mentions that in the Tokyo Olympics, Fethi Nourine withdrew to avoid a potential matchup with Butbul. <image:2326> <image:i> <image:1>


## Elaboration
The evidence indicates that Algerian judoka Messaoud Redouane Dris did not compete against Israeli Tohar Butbul at the Paris Olympics because he failed to make weight. The International Judo Federation is investigating the situation.

The evidence also mentions that this is not the first time an Algerian judoka has avoided a match with Butbul. In the Tokyo Olympics, Fethi Nourine withdrew to avoid a potential matchup with Butbul.


## Final Judgement
The evidence confirms that an Algerian judoka, Messaoud Redouane Dris, did not compete against an Israeli opponent, Tohar Butbul, at the Paris Olympics. The reason given was that Dris failed to make weight, and the International Judo Federation is investigating. This is not the first time an Algerian judoka has withdrawn to avoid a match with an Israeli opponent.

`true`


## Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
An Algerian judoka, Messaoud Redouane Dris, did not compete against Israeli Tohar Butbul at the Paris Olympics because he failed to make weight, according to reports from ESPN ([https://www.espn.com/olympics/story/_/id/40680600/judo-org-probe-failed-weigh-match](https://www.espn.com/olympics/story/_/id/40680600/judo-org-probe-failed-weigh-match)), The Guardian ([https://www.theguardian.com/sport/article/2024/jul/29/algerian-judoka-investigated-after-failing-to-make-weight-for-bout-with-israeli](https://www.theguardian.com/sport/article/2024/jul/29/algerian-judoka-investigated-after-failing-to-make-weight-for-bout-with-israeli)), and the Associated Press ([https://apnews.com/article/olympics-2024-israel-algeria-5925a924c57c1d6440b2cbf09d57cb75](https://apnews.com/article/olympics-2024-israel-algeria-5925a924c57c1d6440b2cbf09d57cb75)).

PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

* `reverse_search`
   * Description: Performs a reverse image search to find similar images on the web.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will perform a reverse search to find similar images.
   * Format: reverse_search(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealandâ€™s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

# Example: reverse_search()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a rare event of a solar eclipse with a double ring."

...

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:k>)
```

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:58> This image shows the aftermath of a Houthi attack on Tel Aviv, Israel, in July 2024."

# Your Actions



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
```
reverse_search(<image:58>)
web_search("Houthi attack Tel Aviv July 2024")
```

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

0min

Explosion in Tel Aviv building, bomb disposal experts on site: Israeli police

A powerful explosion of unknown origin went off in a building in Tel Aviv before 4:00 am (0100 GMT), Israeli police said Friday.  
  
"Numerous police officers and bomb disposal experts have arrived on the scene and are dealing with the situation," police said in a statement without giving further details.  
  
AFP

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The LBC Group website published an article on July 19, 2024, reporting an explosion in a Tel Aviv building. <image:2339> The article mentions that Israeli police and bomb disposal experts were on the scene.

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:58> This image shows the aftermath of a Houthi attack on Tel Aviv, Israel, in July 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:58>)
web_search("Houthi attack Tel Aviv July 2024")
```

The Times of Israel liveblogged Saturdayâ€™s events as they unfolded.

[3:40 am](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/rocket-sirens-sound-in-sderot-kibbutz-nir-am/)

#### [Rocket sirens sound in Sderot, Kibbutz Nir Am](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/rocket-sirens-sound-in-sderot-kibbutz-nir-am/)

Sirens warning of incoming rocket attacks sound again in southern Israel. They are heard in Sderot, Kibbutz Nir Am, Yad Mordechai, and Netiv Haâ€™asara, all near the Gaza Strip.

Earlier overnight, a home in Sderot suffered a direct rocket hit, causing no injuries but significant damage.

[3:17 am](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/sderot-mayor-decries-massacre-of-innocent-civilians-calls-to-erase-hamas/)

#### [Sderot mayor decries â€˜massacre of innocent civilians,â€™ calls to erase Hamas](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/sderot-mayor-decries-massacre-of-innocent-civilians-calls-to-erase-hamas/)

Sderot Mayor Alon Davidi tells residents to stay in their homes behind locked doors and not open them until instructed otherwise, as Israeli security forces work to find and apprehend an unknown number of Palestinian terrorists who infiltrated this morning from Gaza into Israeli communities and gunned down people in the streets and in their homes.

Davidi decries the â€œmassacre of innocent civilians everywhere,â€ and calls for Israelâ€™s leadership to deal a significant blow to Hamas.

â€œWe need to take over Gaza and kill them, they need to be erased,â€ he tells Channel 12.

[3:07 am](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/rocket-sirens-sound-in-kibbutz-beeri-where-israeli-forces-battle-palestinian-terrorists/)

#### [Rocket sirens sound in Kibbutz Beâ€™eri where Israeli forces battle Palestinian terrorists](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/rocket-sirens-sound-in-kibbutz-beeri-where-israeli-forces-battle-palestinian-terrorists/)

Sirens warning of incoming rockets are sounding in Kibbutz Beâ€™eri in southern Israel where Israeli security forces and Palestinian terrorists who infiltrated into the kibbutz from Gaza are engaged in a gun battle.

Hebrew media reports say Israeli forces are still working to clear the kibbutz of terrorists and exchanges of gunfire can be heard.

Earlier, dozens of people were rescued from the kibbutz dining hall where they were held hostage for hours. According to public broadcaster Kan, at least 48 people were rescued in the incident.

[3:02 am](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/woman-seriously-injured-in-rocket-hit-in-ashkelon-five-more-lightly-wounded/)

#### [Woman seriously injured in rocket hit in Ashkelon, five more lightly wounded](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/woman-seriously-injured-in-rocket-hit-in-ashkelon-five-more-lightly-wounded/)

The Magen David Adom ambulance services says a 50-year-old woman was seriously injured in a rocket attack in Ashkelon tonight, and five other sustained light injuries.

The Barzilai Medical Center in the city was hit by a rocket launched from the Gaza Strip amid the ongoing, unprecedented attack on Israel.

[2:44 am](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/barzilai-hospital-in-ashkelon-suffers-rocket-hit-no-injuries-reported/)

#### [Barzilai hospital in Ashkelon suffers rocket hit; no injuries reported](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/barzilai-hospital-in-ashkelon-suffers-rocket-hit-no-injuries-reported/)

The Barzilai Medical Center in the southern city of Ashkelon is hit by a rocket fired from the Gaza Strip. The rocket struck a bridge between buildings at the hospital.

There are no immediate reports of injuries, but significant damage was sustained, a hospital official tells Channel 12.

[2:39 am](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/israeli-hostages-rescued-in-ofakim-terrorists-killed/)

#### [Two Israeli hostages rescued in Ofakim; terrorists killed](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/israeli-hostages-rescued-in-ofakim-terrorists-killed/)

Two Israelis who were taken hostage in a home in the southern town of Ofakim have been rescued by Israeli security forces, according to Hebrew-language media.

Four terrorists at the home were killed, according to the reports. At least one member of Israelâ€™s security forces was injured.

[2:35 am](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/security-cabinet-says-israel-will-destroy-military-governmental-abilities-of-hamas-islamic-jihad/)

#### [Security cabinet says Israel will destroy military, governmental abilities of Hamas, Islamic Jihad](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/security-cabinet-says-israel-will-destroy-military-governmental-abilities-of-hamas-islamic-jihad/)

By [ToI Staff](https://www.timesofisrael.com/writers/times-of-israel-staff/ "ToI Staff")

The Prime Ministerâ€™s Office says the security cabinet ended its meeting tonight, following a day of unprecedented attacks by Hamas against Israelis, and has made a â€œseries of operational decisions aimed at bringing about the destruction of the military and governmental capabilities of Hamas and Palestinian Islamic Jihad.â€

His office says Israelâ€™s response will take away â€œtheir ability and desire to threaten and harm the citizens of Israel for many years.â€

Among the decisions made by the cabinet are stopping the supply of electricity, fuel and goods to the Gaza Strip.

[![A French officer stands guard near a synagogue in Marseille on November 3, 2020. (Christophe SIMON / AFP)")](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/germany-france-step-up-security-at-jewish-sites-amid-israel-war/)

Illustrative: A French officer stands guard near a synagogue in Marseille on November 3, 2020. (Christophe SIMON / AFP)

Germany and France move to reinforce security around Jewish temples, schools and monuments after the surprise attack by Hamas against Israel.

Germany tightens police protection of Jewish and Israeli institutions, as some supporters of the Palestinians took to the streets of Berlin to celebrate the attack.

France is focusing on Jewish temples and schools in cities across the country, as one Jewish leader expresses concern at the possibility the conflict might be imported there.

â€œIn Berlin, police protection has been immediately stepped up,â€ Germanyâ€™s Interior Minister Nancy Faeser tells Bild newspaper. â€œThe federal government and the regions are closely coordinating their actions.â€

Germanyâ€™s authorities are also closely watching â€œpotential supporters of Hamas in the Islamist sphere,â€ she adds.

In France, security had already been stepped up at synagogues in Paris, Marseille, Lyon and Strasbourg because of the holiday period being observed since late September.

Interior Minister Gerald Darmanin sends an urgent message to prefects running the countryâ€™s regions asking them to reinforce surveillance even further.

â€œAt a time when terrorist attacks from Gaza are hitting Israel, I ask you to immediately step up vigilance, security and protection of Jewish community sites in France,â€ he writes in a message seen by AFP.

He called for a â€œvisible and systematic static presence,â€ and the use of soldiers from Franceâ€™s Operation Sentinelle, a special force deployed across the country since the 2015 terror attacks. The interior ministry will review the security situation at a special meeting tomorrow.

[11:44 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/hamas-official-our-attack-has-only-just-begun/)

#### [Hamas official: Our attack has only just begun](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/hamas-official-our-attack-has-only-just-begun/)

By [Gianluca Pacchiani](https://www.timesofisrael.com/writers/gianluca-pacchiani/ "Gianluca Pacchiani")

Hussam Badran, a member of the political bureau of Hamas, says the terror groupâ€™s onslaught is only in its early stages.

Badran says the attack, called the â€œAl-Aqsa Delugeâ€ by the terror group, comes after careful preparation aimed at catching Israel by surprise.

The terror leader says this battle is different from all previous rounds of conflict, and calls on Arab mediators to convey to Israel that it must â€œleave our occupied lands.â€

He adds that Hamas does not expect them to be mediators but rather supporters of its position.

Like a number of Hamas leaders who have issued statements today, Badran claims the attack is motivated by Israeli control over the flashpoint Al-Aqsa mosque in Jerusalem.

The mosque, the third holiest site for Muslims, sits atop the Temple Mount, the holiest site for Jews as the location of the biblical temples. Israel has long maintained a delicate status quo at the site, in which Jews are allowed to visit during limited hours, but not pray. Terror groups have repeatedly used baseless claims of Israeli intentions to take over the mosque as a pretext for violence.

Badran also blames Israeli policies in the West Bank and its treatment of Palestinian prisoners for the attack, adding that â€œwe are the owners of this land, and this occupation will not last forever.â€

The surprise onslaught against Israel has killed at least 250 Israelis, including many civilians, and injured over 1,000. An unspecified number of Israelis, living and dead, are held hostage by terrorists in Gaza.

[11:41 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/ireland-condemns-hamas-attack-stresses-need-for-moderate-voices/)

#### [Ireland condemns Hamas attack, stresses need for â€˜moderate voicesâ€™](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/ireland-condemns-hamas-attack-stresses-need-for-moderate-voices/)

By [AFP](https://www.timesofisrael.com/writers/afp/ "AFP")

Irish deputy premier and foreign affairs minister Micheal Martin condemns the attack by Hamas on Israeli citizens, and says it is â€œvital that the voice of moderation comes to the fore.â€

Martin says he could â€œsee tensions risingâ€ during a recent trip to the region, and that the scale of todayâ€™s attack is â€œquite shocking.â€

â€œWe believe a two-state solution remains the only sensible and rational solution to this issue and it needs political momentum behind it,â€ he says.

â€œMy sense is that the hardliners are growing in influence, and thatâ€™s why I believe the need to have moderate voices in the center is key,â€ he says.

â€œSo what we need really is a political peace process to get on track in a serious way. That will mean I think, international intervention as well to facilitate that, but itâ€™s a very, very complex and difficult situation and there will be many consequences to todayâ€™s attack.â€

[11:38 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/courts-system-to-operate-on-emergency-mode-tomorrow-amid-war/)

#### [Courts system to operate on emergency mode tomorrow amid war](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/courts-system-to-operate-on-emergency-mode-tomorrow-amid-war/)

By [Jeremy Sharon](https://www.timesofisrael.com/writers/jeremy-sharon/ "Jeremy Sharon")

[![An illustrative photo of a court room in the Supreme Court in Jerusalem, August 1, 2023. (Chaim Goldberg/FLASH90)](https://static.timesofisrael.com/www/uploads/2023/09/F230801CG05-e1694469761890-640x400.jpg "An illustrative photo of a court room in the Supreme Court in Jerusalem, August 1, 2023. (Chaim Goldberg/FLASH90)")](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/courts-system-to-operate-on-emergency-mode-tomorrow-amid-war/)

An illustrative photo of a court room in the Supreme Court in Jerusalem, August 1, 2023. (Chaim Goldberg/FLASH90)

Israelâ€™s courts will operate on an emergency footing tomorrow and will only hold hearings on urgent matters due to the Hamas invasion of southern Israel and the war with Gaza, it announces.

A statement put out by the Israel Courts Administration says the decision was made by Justice Minister Yariv Levin â€œwith the knowledge of and \[in accordance with the\] opinion of Supreme Court President Justice Esther Hayut and Director of the Courts Administration Judge Michael Spitzer.â€

The decision applies to Israelâ€™s magistrates, district and labor courts, as well as the Supreme Court and the rabbinical courts.

Hearings scheduled for parole committees on Sunday will be postponed to a later date.

[11:29 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/commander-of-idf-nahal-brigade-killed-during-clashes-with-hamas-idf-says/)

#### [Commander of IDF Nahal Brigade killed during clashes with Hamas, IDF says](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/commander-of-idf-nahal-brigade-killed-during-clashes-with-hamas-idf-says/)

By [Emanuel Fabian](https://www.timesofisrael.com/writers/emanuel-fabian/ "Emanuel Fabian")

[![Col. Jonathan Steinberg, the commander of the Nahal Brigade, in an undated photo (Israel Defense Forces)")](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/commander-of-idf-nahal-brigade-killed-during-clashes-with-hamas-idf-says/)

Col. Jonathan Steinberg, the commander of the Nahal Brigade, in an undated photo (Israel Defense Forces)

The commanding officer of the Nahal Infantry Brigade, Col. JonathanÂ Steinberg, was killed this morning during clashes with Hamas terrorists in the Kerem Shalom area near the border with the Gaza Strip, the military says.

Steinberg, 42, from the southern town of Shomria, was en route to the site of clashes being managed by his subordinates when he encountered a terrorist who killed him.

He is one of the most senior Israeli officers to have been killed in combat in recent memory.

[![Bodies lie on a main road near Kibbutz Gevim on October 7, 2023 following an attack by Hamas terrorists. The toll is expected to continue to rise.

At least 1,450 have been wounded, many seriously.

Dozens of civilians as well as IDF soldiers are believed to have been abducted and brought into Gaza; the IDF has confirmed that soldiers and civilians have been taken hostage, but has not specified a number.

Thousands of rockets have been fired at the south and center of the country, killing a number of people.

US President Joe Biden speaks about the terror attack against Israel, October 7, 2023. (Screenshot/Used in accordance with clause 27a of the copyright law)

US President Joe Biden backs Israelâ€™s right to self defense, warns other parties in the region against joining the attack against the Jewish state, and says he is in contact with leaders around the region.

â€œToday the people of Israel are under attack orchestrated by a terrorist organization, Hamas. In this moment of tragedy, I want to say to them and to the world and to terrorists everywhere, the United States stands with Israel. We will not ever fail to have their back, weâ€™ll make sure that theyâ€™ll have the help their citizens need and they can continue to defend themselves,â€ Biden says in a broadcast, while flanked by US Secretary of State Antony Blinken.
