*   [!Aid to quake-hit Syria slowed by sanctions, war's divisions <image:2595>Aid to quake-hit Syria slowed by sanctions, war's divisions](/news/world/americas/syria-ap-aid-turkey-damascus-b2277643.html)
    
*   [!Miracle baby born in Turkey earthquake rubble as mother trapped during labour dies <image:2596>Miracle baby born in Turkey earthquake rubble as mother trapped during labour dies](/news/world/middle-east/turkey-earthquake-baby-born-syria-b2277237.html)
    
*   [!Before and after pictures show scale of devastation caused by Turkey earthquake <image:2597>Before and after pictures show scale of devastation caused by Turkey earthquake](/news/world/middle-east/turkey-syria-earthquake-damage-before-after-b2277523.html)
    
*   [!20,000 feared dead in earthquake carnage as rescuers race against time to save trapped victims <image:2598>20,000 feared dead in earthquake carnage as rescuers race against time to save trapped victims](/news/world/europe/earthquake-turkey-unicef-relief-death-b2277435.html)
    

Close by but not pictured, a man with a sledgehammer tries to smash his way through the ruins beside the heartbreaking scene. Here, rescuers and civilians have been working since Monday to recover their loved ones.

[With over 7,200 confirmed dead](/news/world/europe/turkey-syria-earthquake-map-deaths-fault-lines-latest-b2277048.html)
 following two magnitude 7.8 and 7.5 earthquakes across southeastern Turkey and parts of Syria, the region is reeling amidst the devastation.

[Search and recovery efforts have been ongoing](/news/ap-turkey-syria-men-antalya-b2277620.html)
 since the first quake hit in the early hours of February 6. [The second hit approximately 9 hours later](/news/world/middle-east/turkey-syria-earthquake-damage-before-after-b2277523.html)
, followed by more than 200 aftershocks.

!Mesut Hancer holds the hand of his 15-year-old daughter Irmak, who died in the earthquake in Kahramanmaras, close to the quakeâ€™s epicentre <image:2599>

open image in gallery

Mesut Hancer holds the hand of his 15-year-old daughter Irmak, who died in the earthquake in Kahramanmaras, close to the quakeâ€™s epicentre (AFP via Getty Images)

The earthquake occurred around 4km southeast of EkinÃ¶zÃ¼ in the KahramanmaraÅŸ province, where Mr Hancer and his daughter are pictured. Some of the heaviest devastation occurred between Kahramanmaras and Gaziantep, a city of two million people where entire streets now lie in ruins as snow falls.

Turkish authorities report that 13.5 million people were affected across an area spanning roughly 450km from Adana in the west to Diyarbakir in the east, and 300km from Malatya in the north to Hatay in the south.

In Syria, [a newborn baby was rescued from beneath a collapsed building](/news/world/middle-east/turkey-earthquake-baby-born-syria-b2277237.html "Miracle baby born in Turkey earthquake rubble as mother trapped during labour dies")
, still connected to her dead mother via her umbilical cord. The woman gave birth whilst buried beneath the rubble in the wake of the earthquakes.

!Moment newborn baby rescued from rubble after Turkey earthquake destroys home <image:2600>

open image in gallery

Moment newborn baby rescued from rubble after Turkey earthquake destroys home (Twitter)

Another heartbreaking story of loss, the newborn was the only member of her family to survive. She is believed to have been born three hours earlier, according to how far her temperature had plummeted.

Footage of the rescue shows a search team member lifting the dust-covered infant to safety in the small town of Jinderis. Located in the rebel-held enclave of northwest Syria close to the Turkish border, it was hard hit by the quake with multiple buildings destroyed.

* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.sbs.com.au/news/article/the-story-behind-this-turkey-earthquake-photo-that-many-will-never-forget/2ijedstvo): Found exact image on website with title: Turkey earthquake: Story behind photo that 'many will never forget'
Content: "[World](/news/tag/section/world)

The story behind this Turkey earthquake photo that 'many will never forget'
===========================================================================

Turkish father Mesut Hancer wanted the world to see his â€” and his nation's â€” grief. And it did.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

![A man sitting holding the hand of someone who is beneath rubble.](https://images.sbs.com.au/dims4/default/f96276f/2147483647/strip/true/crop/3039x1710+463+624/resize/1280x720!/quality/90/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fsbs-au-brightspot.s3.amazonaws.com%2F6e%2Ff1%2Ff608b67744b0b21f069d8e6188b7%2Fgettyimages-1246861398.jpg&imwidth=1280)

Mesut Hancer holds the hand of his 15-year-old daughter, Irmak, who died in the earthquake in the Turkish province of Kahramanmaras, close to the earthquake's epicentre. Source: Getty, AFP / Adem Altan

###### KEY POINTS

*   Mesut Hancer was photographed as he held the hand of his daughter who was buried beneath debris.
*   It was a delicate moment. But instead of shooing a photographer away, the father called him in.
*   The photo appeared on the front pages of major newspapers across the world

It was a moment encapsulating the unspeakable pain of the Turkish earthquake: a father holding his 15-year-old's hand, the only thing visible after her body was crushed by concrete.  
  

Mesut Hancer sat alone in the freezing cold on a pile of broken bricks that were once his home, oblivious to the world and overwhelmed by grief.  
  

His daughter, Irmak, was dead. But he refused to let her go, caressing the fingers peeking out from a mattress the girl was asleep on when [the first pre-dawn tremor struck on Monday](/news/article/australia-pledges-10-million-in-aid-to-syria-and-turkey-as-devastating-earthquake-kills-thousands/s7c0xn5y5)
.  
  

There were no rescue teams. Survivors were frantically clawing their way through the rubble to find loved ones, bits of their homes thrown out onto the debris-strewn street.  

!A man sitting down and holding the hand of someone who is beneath rubble.  <image:2601>

Mesut Hancer sat alone in the freezing cold on a pile of broken bricks that were once his home, oblivious to the world and overwhelmed by grief. Source: Getty, AFP / Adem Altan

Bedframes lay on top of shattered balconies. Torn clothes and toys told the tale of lives lost.  
  

It was too late for Irmak, one of nearly 20,000 people confirmed to have died in [the most powerful earthquake to strike Turkey and Syria in nearly a century](/news/article/the-three-reasons-why-the-turkey-syria-earthquake-was-so-devastating/qgetwuxvv)
.  
  

But Adem Altan, a veteran photographer with news agency AFP who rushed to the scene from Ankara, could not take his eyes off the still, silently mourning father.  
  

He trained his camera on Mr Hancer from 60 metres away. It was a delicate moment. But instead of shooing Mr Altan away, the father called him in.  
  

"Take pictures of my child," Mr Hancer called in a low, trembling voice.  

###### READ MORE

[![](https://images.sbs.com.au/dims4/default/4ede20e/2147483647/strip/true/crop/4771x2684+0+249/resize/1280x720!/quality/90/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fsbs-au-brightspot.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fb6%2F38%2F3acc3a3a4ed696ccfa9f56df7611%2Fgettyimages-1246843357.jpg&imwidth=1280 "Image for read more article 'READ MORE'")\
\
How to help those impacted by the devastating earthquakes in Syria and Turkey](/news/article/how-to-help-those-impacted-by-horrifying-earthquake-in-syria-and-turkey/qjdnzpz1h)

### 'I was speechless'

The father wanted the world to see his â€” and his nation's â€” grief. And it did.  
  

The AFP photograph appeared on the front pages of major newspapers across the world, including the Financial Times and the Wall Street Journal.  
  

"As I took photos, I was so sad. I kept repeating to myself, 'what immense pain'. I couldn't stop myself from crying," Mr Altan recalled.  
  

"I was speechless."  
  

Mr Altan asked Hancer his name and then his daughter's name.  

!People walking past destroyed buildings. <image:2602>

The aftermath of the earthquake in Idlib, Syria. Source: Getty / dia images/Zana Halil

"He was speaking with difficulty, so I could not talk to him too much," Mr Altan said.  
  

Mr Altan could not ask too many questions because everyone needed to observe silence to hear whether there were survivors underneath the rubble.  
  

A photographer for 40 years, including 15 with AFP, Mr Altan knew that the photograph represented Turkey's pain.  
  

But its global impact surprised him. It has been shared hundreds of thousands of times online.  
  

Mr Altan has received thousands of messages from people worldwide, wanting to offer support.  
  

"Many told me they will never forget this image," he said.  

### Hope for more survivors fades

Cold, hunger and despair gripped hundreds of thousands of people left homeless after the earthquakes that struck Turkey and Syria three days ago as the death toll passed 20,000 on Thursday.  
  

The rescue of a 2-year-old boy after 79 hours trapped in the rubble of a collapsed building in Hatay, Turkey, and several other people raised spirits among weary search crews. But hopes were fading that many more would be found alive in the ruins of towns and cities.  
  

The death toll across both countries has now surpassed the more than 17,000 killed in 1999 when a similarly powerful quake hit northwest Turkey.  

![Some rescue workers inspect an area while others are seen carrying a child.](https://images.sbs.com.au/42/b1/c27f81814ed3ad88aa71bb9ee709/gettyimages-1246959595.jpg?imwidth=1280)

Hope of finding earthquake survivors is fading. Source: Getty, Anadolu / Serkan Avci

A Turkish official said the disaster posed "very serious difficulties" for the holding of an election scheduled for 14 May in which President Tayyip Erdogan has been expected to face his toughest challenge in two decades in power.  
  

With anger simmering over delays in the delivery of aid and getting the rescue effort underway, the disaster is likely to play into the vote if it goes ahead.  
  

The first United Nations convoy carrying aid to stricken Syrians crossed over the border from Turkey.  

###### READ MORE

[![](https://images.sbs.com.au/dims4/default/e50c855/2147483647/strip/true/crop/1920x1080+0+0/resize/1280x720!/quality/90/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fsbs-au-brightspot.s3.amazonaws.com%2F1d%2Fc4%2F6f195638470c8dc7981f80c9fce8%2Faustralian-pahali-earthquake.jpg&imwidth=1280 "Image for read more article 'READ MORE'")\
\
Australian man Can Pahali dead after devastating Turkey earthquake](/news/article/australian-man-can-pahali-dead-after-devastating-turkey-earthquake/2nb4ppnne)

In Syria's Idlib province, Munira Mohammad, a mother of four who fled Aleppo after the quake, said: "It is all children here, and we need heating and supplies, last night we couldn't sleep because it was so cold. It is very bad."  
  

Hundreds of thousands of people in both countries have been left homeless in the middle of winter. Many have camped out in makeshift shelters in supermarket car parks, mosques, roadsides or amid the ruins, often desperate for food, water and heat.  
  

Some 40 per cent of buildings in the Turkish city of Kahramanmaras, epicentre of the tremor, are damaged, according to a preliminary report by Turkey's Bogazici University.

Content: The image shows a Turkish father, Mesut Hancer, holding the hand of his 15-year-old daughter, Irmak, who died in the earthquake in the Turkish province of Kahramanmaras. <image:62>, <image:2601>. The photo was taken by Adem Altan, a photographer with news agency AFP. The article was published on February 10, 2023.


From [Source](https://www.cnn.com/2023/02/13/middleeast/turkey-quake-man-daughter-hand-photo-intl): Found exact image on website with title: Behind the defining image of the Turkey earthquake | CNN
Content: The image shows Mesut Hancer holding the hand of his 15-year-old daughter, Irmak, who died in an earthquake in Kahramanmaras, Turkey, on February 7, 2023. <image:62>. The article was published on February 13, 2023, by CNN.


## Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image shows a father, Mesut Hancer, holding the hand of his 15-year-old daughter, Irmak, who died in an earthquake in Kahramanmaras, Turkey. The earthquake occurred on February 6 or 7, 2023. The photo was taken by Adem Altan.

The image is featured in articles from The Independent ([https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/turkey-earthquake-father-daughter-hold-hands-b2277655.html](https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/turkey-earthquake-father-daughter-hold-hands-b2277655.html)), SBS News ([https://www.sbs.com.au/news/article/the-story-behind-this-turkey-earthquake-photo-that-many-will-never-forget/2ijedstvo](https://www.sbs.com.au/news/article/the-story-behind-this-turkey-earthquake-photo-that-many-will-never-forget/2ijedstvo)), and CNN ([https://www.cnn.com/2023/02/13/middleeast/turkey-quake-man-daughter-hand-photo-intl](https://www.cnn.com/2023/02/13/middleeast/turkey-quake-man-daughter-hand-photo-intl)). <image:62>

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:62> This image shows a man from Gaza holding the hand of his son killed in an Israeli bombing in July, 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:62>)
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `reverse_search`
The image shows a father, Mesut Hancer, holding the hand of his 15-year-old daughter, Irmak, who died in an earthquake in Kahramanmaras, Turkey. The earthquake occurred on February 6 or 7, 2023. The photo was taken by Adem Altan.

The image is featured in articles from The Independent ([https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/turkey-earthquake-father-daughter-hold-hands-b2277655.html](https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/turkey-earthquake-father-daughter-hold-hands-b2277655.html)), SBS News ([https://www.sbs.com.au/news/article/the-story-behind-this-turkey-earthquake-photo-that-many-will-never-forget/2ijedstvo](https://www.sbs.com.au/news/article/the-story-behind-this-turkey-earthquake-photo-that-many-will-never-forget/2ijedstvo)), and CNN ([https://www.cnn.com/2023/02/13/middleeast/turkey-quake-man-daughter-hand-photo-intl](https://www.cnn.com/2023/02/13/middleeast/turkey-quake-man-daughter-hand-photo-intl)). <image:62>


# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The evidence contradicts the claim. The image depicts Mesut Hancer holding the hand of his deceased daughter, Irmak, who died in an earthquake in Turkey in February 2023, not a bombing in Gaza in July 2024. The evidence includes links to articles from The Independent, SBS News, and CNN that confirm this information.

JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:62> This image shows a man from Gaza holding the hand of his son killed in an Israeli bombing in July, 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:62>)
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `reverse_search`
The image shows a father, Mesut Hancer, holding the hand of his 15-year-old daughter, Irmak, who died in an earthquake in Kahramanmaras, Turkey. The earthquake occurred on February 6 or 7, 2023. The photo was taken by Adem Altan.

The image is featured in articles from The Independent ([https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/turkey-earthquake-father-daughter-hold-hands-b2277655.html](https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/turkey-earthquake-father-daughter-hold-hands-b2277655.html)), SBS News ([https://www.sbs.com.au/news/article/the-story-behind-this-turkey-earthquake-photo-that-many-will-never-forget/2ijedstvo](https://www.sbs.com.au/news/article/the-story-behind-this-turkey-earthquake-photo-that-many-will-never-forget/2ijedstvo)), and CNN ([https://www.cnn.com/2023/02/13/middleeast/turkey-quake-man-daughter-hand-photo-intl](https://www.cnn.com/2023/02/13/middleeast/turkey-quake-man-daughter-hand-photo-intl)). <image:62>


## Elaboration
The evidence contradicts the claim. The image depicts Mesut Hancer holding the hand of his deceased daughter, Irmak, who died in an earthquake in Turkey in February 2023, not a bombing in Gaza in July 2024. The evidence includes links to articles from The Independent, SBS News, and CNN that confirm this information.


# Your Judgement



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image shows a man in Turkey holding the hand of his deceased daughter after an earthquake in February 2023, not a man from Gaza holding the hand of his son killed in an Israeli bombing in July 2024. The claim is therefore false.

`false`

SummarizeDocPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You are provided with the record of a fact-check. It contains the Claim to be verified and a documentation of all the fact-checking work along the gathered evidence. Your task is to **summarize the fact-check**. That is, you provide a concise, one-paragraph justification for the final VERDICT based on the knowledge from the Record. Note:
* Be truthful, brief, do not add any additional information besides the information given in the Record. 
* Link key sources in your summary. Use Markdown notation for that. You may link them in-line.
* Don't state the Claim again. Rather focus on the key insights of the fact-check.
* Simply print just the summary.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:62> This image shows a man from Gaza holding the hand of his son killed in an Israeli bombing in July, 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:62>)
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `reverse_search`
The image shows a father, Mesut Hancer, holding the hand of his 15-year-old daughter, Irmak, who died in an earthquake in Kahramanmaras, Turkey. The earthquake occurred on February 6 or 7, 2023. The photo was taken by Adem Altan.

The image is featured in articles from The Independent ([https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/turkey-earthquake-father-daughter-hold-hands-b2277655.html](https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/turkey-earthquake-father-daughter-hold-hands-b2277655.html)), SBS News ([https://www.sbs.com.au/news/article/the-story-behind-this-turkey-earthquake-photo-that-many-will-never-forget/2ijedstvo](https://www.sbs.com.au/news/article/the-story-behind-this-turkey-earthquake-photo-that-many-will-never-forget/2ijedstvo)), and CNN ([https://www.cnn.com/2023/02/13/middleeast/turkey-quake-man-daughter-hand-photo-intl](https://www.cnn.com/2023/02/13/middleeast/turkey-quake-man-daughter-hand-photo-intl)). <image:62>


## Elaboration
The evidence contradicts the claim. The image depicts Mesut Hancer holding the hand of his deceased daughter, Irmak, who died in an earthquake in Turkey in February 2023, not a bombing in Gaza in July 2024. The evidence includes links to articles from The Independent, SBS News, and CNN that confirm this information.


## Final Judgement
The image shows a man in Turkey holding the hand of his deceased daughter after an earthquake in February 2023, not a man from Gaza holding the hand of his son killed in an Israeli bombing in July 2024. The claim is therefore false.

`false`

## Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image shows a father, Mesut Hancer, holding the hand of his deceased daughter, Irmak, after an earthquake in Kahramanmaras, Turkey, in February 2023, as reported by sources like The Independent ([https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/turkey-earthquake-father-daughter-hold-hands-b2277655.html](https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/turkey-earthquake-father-daughter-hold-hands-b2277655.html)), SBS News ([https://www.sbs.com.au/news/article/the-story-behind-this-turkey-earthquake-photo-that-many-will-never-forget/2ijedstvo](https://www.sbs.com.au/news/article/the-story-behind-this-turkey-earthquake-photo-that-many-will-never-forget/2ijedstvo)), and CNN ([https://www.cnn.com/2023/02/13/middleeast/turkey-quake-man-daughter-hand-photo-intl](https://www.cnn.com/2023/02/13/middleeast/turkey-quake-man-daughter-hand-photo-intl)). The claim misrepresents the context and location of the event.

PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

* `reverse_search`
   * Description: Performs a reverse image search to find similar images on the web.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will perform a reverse search to find similar images.
   * Format: reverse_search(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealandâ€™s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

Israeli warplanes bombed Al Jaoni School in Nuseirat, Saturday afternoon, where thousands of displaced Palestinians are taking refuge. He writes at [https://crossfirearabia.com/](https://crossfirearabia.com/)

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The article from Countercurrents.org, published on July 7, 2024, reports that Israel bombed the Al Jaoni School in the Nuseirat refugee camp on July 6, 2024. The school was sheltering displaced Palestinians. The article mentions that Mayar Haidar (9 years old) and Bilal Hamida (6 years old) were killed in the bombing, along with their mother and grandmother. <image:63> The article also includes images from social media.

_________________________



SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:63> This image shows Mayar Hamida (9 years old) and Bilal Hamida (6 years old) who were killed by Israel along with their mother and grandmother at Al-Jaoni UN school in Al-Nuseirat refugee camp on July, 6 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:63>)
```

## Evidence
No new evidence found.

## Elaboration
There is insufficient information to verify the claim. The reverse image search did not yield any results. Therefore, the claim cannot be verified.


## Actions
```
web_search("Mayar Hamida Bilal Hamida killed Israel Al-Nuseirat refugee camp July 6 2024")
web_search("Al-Jaoni UN school Al-Nuseirat refugee camp July 6 2024")
```

# Search Result
From [Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nuseirat_rescue_and_massacre): 
Content: "[Jump to content](#bodyContent)

| 2024 Nuseirat rescue operation and massacre |     |
| --- | --- |
| Part of the [Gaza war](/wiki/Gaza_war "Gaza war") |     |
| [![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/ac/Operation-Summer-Seeds-0002.jpg/330px-Operation-Summer-Seeds-0002.jpg)](/wiki/File:Operation-Summer-Seeds-0002.jpg)<br><br>The landing of the rescued hostages at [Sheba Hospital](/wiki/Sheba_Hospital "Sheba Hospital") |     |
| Location | [Nuseirat refugee camp](/wiki/Nuseirat_refugee_camp "Nuseirat refugee camp") |
| Objective | Rescue [Israeli hostages](/wiki/Gaza_war_hostage_crisis "Gaza war hostage crisis")<br> held by [Hamas](/wiki/Hamas "Hamas") |
| Date | 8 June 2024 |
| ExecutedÂ by | [Yamam](/wiki/Yamam "Yamam")<br>, [Shin Bet](/wiki/Shin_Bet "Shin Bet")<br>, [Israel Defense Forces](/wiki/Israel_Defense_Forces "Israel Defense Forces")<br>, [Israel Air Force](/wiki/Israel_Air_Force "Israel Air Force")<br>[\[8\]](#cite_note-Fabian-2024-9)<br>, [Israeli Navy](/wiki/Israeli_Navy "Israeli Navy")<br>[\[9\]](#cite_note-10) |
| Outcome | *   Four Israeli hostages rescued |
| Casualties | *   One Yamam officer killed<br>*   Per [Gaza Health Ministry](/wiki/Gaza_Health_Ministry "Gaza Health Ministry")<br>    , 276 Palestinians killed and 698+ injured[\[10\]](#cite_note-11)<br>    <br>*   Per IDF, less than 100 Palestinian casualties[\[5\]](#cite_note-The_Times_of_Israel-2024a-6) |

On 8 June 2024, during an operation to rescue hostages held in the [Nuseirat refugee camp](/wiki/Nuseirat_refugee_camp "Nuseirat refugee camp")
, the Israeli military killed at least 276 people and injured over 698, according to the [Gaza Health Ministry](/wiki/Gaza_Health_Ministry "Gaza Health Ministry")
 and Palestinian health officials.[\[b\]](#cite_note-12)
[\[11\]](#cite_note-13)
 The operation's objective was to recover hostages taken during the [7 October Hamas-led attack on Israel](/wiki/7_October_Hamas-led_attack_on_Israel "7 October Hamas-led attack on Israel")
. On 7 October 2023, the Qassam Brigades (the militant wing of the [Hamas](/wiki/Hamas "Hamas")
 party) launched [an attack on Israel](/wiki/2023_Hamas-led_attack_on_Israel "2023 Hamas-led attack on Israel")
.[\[23\]](#cite_note-25)
 As part of the attack, in which other Palestinian militant groups were also involved, Hamas, [Palestinian Islamic Jihad](/wiki/Palestinian_Islamic_Jihad "Palestinian Islamic Jihad")
 and other Palestinian militant groups kidnapped 251 Israeli civilians and soldiers.[\[24\]](#cite_note-Reliefweb-2023-26)
 This attack led to the [Gaza war](/wiki/Gaza_war "Gaza war")
.[\[24\]](#cite_note-Reliefweb-2023-26)

The [Nuseirat refugee camp](/wiki/Nuseirat_refugee_camp "Nuseirat refugee camp")
 is a long-standing [UNRWA](/wiki/UNRWA "UNRWA")
 refugee camp located in the middle of the Gaza Strip, in [Deir al-Balah](/wiki/Deir_al-Balah "Deir al-Balah")
.[\[25\]](#cite_note-27)
 The camp has been repeatedly bombed during the Israel-Hamas war, with over a hundred Palestinians killed in the attacks. [Ynet](/wiki/Ynet "Ynet")
 reported that she also cooked at times with basic ingredients she was provided.[\[36\]](#cite_note-The_Times_of_Israel-2024c-38)

The [Qassam Brigades](/wiki/Qassam_Brigades "Qassam Brigades")
 (the militant wing of the Hamas movement) claimed that three other hostages were killed as a result of the raid.[\[22\]](#cite_note-Al_Jazeera_Arabic-2024-24)
[\[41\]](#cite_note-43)
 They did not name any of them, or show photographs, but they claimed that one of the three was a US citizen and released a short video with text in Arabic, Hebrew, and English.[\[22\]](#cite_note-Al_Jazeera_Arabic-2024-24)
 The video depicted three unidentifiable corpses with their faces obscured by censor bars.[\[42\]](#cite_note-44)
 The Brigades did not give details of how the hostages supposedly died, but said they were killed by the Israeli military.[\[c\]](#cite_note-46)

> "In exchange for them, your own army killed 3 of your own captives in the same attack; one of them holds a USA citizenship" - Qassam Brigades, 9 June 2024.[\[22\]](#cite_note-Al_Jazeera_Arabic-2024-24)

Rescue
------

The IDF said that they worked with [Shin Bet](/wiki/Shin_Bet "Shin Bet")
 and Israeli police to free the four Israeli hostages.[\[44\]](#cite_note-Halavi-2024-47)
 It was also later reported that the operation was [aided by intelligence support from the United States](/wiki/United_States_support_for_Israel_in_the_Gaza_war "United States support for Israel in the Gaza war")
[\[45\]](#cite_note-Brennan-2024-48)
 and the [United Kingdom](/wiki/British_support_for_Israel_in_the_Israel%E2%80%93Hamas_war "British support for Israel in the Israelâ€“Hamas war")
.[\[46\]](#cite_note-49)
 The operation was planned for several weeks, and was carried out after an intelligence opportunity arose.[\[14\]](#cite_note-Thierren-2024-16)
 Some of the special forces members entered the refugee camp in a vehicle with a mattress on top, posing as [Palestinian refugees](/wiki/Gaza_Strip_evacuations "Gaza Strip evacuations")
 fleeing [Rafah](/wiki/Rafah "Rafah")
 per Saudi reporters. The war must end".[\[93\]](#cite_note-96)
    
*    ![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9f/Flag_of_Indonesia.svg/40px-Flag_of_Indonesia.svg.png)[Indonesia](/wiki/Indonesia "Indonesia")
    : the country condemned the "repeated atrocities" committed by Israel in Gaza, including in the Nuseirat refugee camp, and called for an immediate ceasefire.[\[94\]](#cite_note-97)
    
*    ![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c0/Flag_of_Jordan.svg/40px-Flag_of_Jordan.svg.png)[Jordan](/wiki/Jordan "Jordan")
    : the country denounced the killing of civilians and called "on the international community and especially the Security Council to take immediate and urgent action to stop Israel's war crimes in Gaza."[\[95\]](#cite_note-Eichner-2024-98)
    
*    ![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/aa/Flag_of_Kuwait.svg/40px-Flag_of_Kuwait.svg.png)[Kuwait](/wiki/Kuwait "Kuwait")
    : the country denounced the killing of civilians, calling it a "heinous crime".[\[96\]](#cite_note-99)
    
*    ![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/59/Flag_of_Lebanon.svg/40px-Flag_of_Lebanon.svg.png)[Lebanon](/wiki/Lebanon "Lebanon")
    : The [Lebanese Ministry of Foreign Affairs](/wiki/Ministry_of_Foreign_Affairs_and_Emigrants_(Lebanon) "Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Emigrants (Lebanon)")
     called the operation a massacre.[\[97\]](#cite_note-100)
    
*    ![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d9/Flag_of_Norway.svg/40px-Flag_of_Norway.svg.png)[Norway](/wiki/Norway "Norway")
    : Deputy Foreign Minister Andreas Motzfeldt Kravik condemned the attack on civilians and called for the release of all hostages.[\[95\]](#cite_note-Eichner-2024-98)
    
*    ![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/1/12/Flag_of_Poland.svg/40px-Flag_of_Poland.svg.png)[Poland](/wiki/Poland "Poland")
    : Foreign Minister [RadosÅ‚aw Sikorski](/wiki/Rados%C5%82aw_Sikorski "RadosÅ‚aw Sikorski")
     wrote: "Bravo, IDF. Israel has shown itself time and time again that it does not care about international and humanitarian laws."[\[112\]](#cite_note-115)
    
*   [Kenneth Roth](/wiki/Kenneth_Roth "Kenneth Roth")
    , the former director of [Human Rights Watch](/wiki/Human_Rights_Watch "Human Rights Watch")
     and a professor at [Princeton University](/wiki/Princeton_University "Princeton University")
    , stated the attack was "inconsistent with the duty to take all feasible precautions to spare civilians harm."[\[113\]](#cite_note-116)

Nuseirat rescue and massacre

9 languages [Add topic](#) EU foreign policy chief [Josep Borrell](/wiki/Josep_Borrell "Josep Borrell")
 described the events as a "bloodbath."[\[16\]](#cite_note-18)
 The [Gaza Health Ministry](/wiki/Gaza_Health_Ministry "Gaza Health Ministry")
 reported that at least 274 Palestinians were killed in the camp, including 64 children and 57 women,[\[17\]](#cite_note-Taheri-2024-19)
 with at least 698 people reported injured.[\[18\]](#cite_note-20)
 The IDF said they were aware of fewer than 100 Palestinian casualties.[\[5\]](#cite_note-The_Times_of_Israel-2024a-6)
 [Yamam](/wiki/Yamam "Yamam")
 officer Arnon Zamora was seriously injured and later died from his injuries.[\[19\]](#cite_note-21)

Following the operation, [Al-Qassam Brigades](/wiki/Qassam_Brigades "Qassam Brigades")
 spokesman [Abu Obaida](/wiki/Abu_Obaida_(Hamas) "Abu Obaida (Hamas)")
 warned that it would result in greater threats to the [Israeli hostages](/wiki/Israeli_hostages "Israeli hostages")
.[\[20\]](#cite_note-The_Times_of_Israel-2024b-22)
 The brigades later released a short video saying that the raid had also killed three unnamed Israeli hostages, including one with dual citizenship of the USA."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The Wikipedia article "Nuseirat rescue and massacre" discusses an Israeli military operation on June 8, 2024, in the Nuseirat refugee camp in Gaza. The operation aimed to rescue Israeli hostages and resulted in the deaths of at least 276 Palestinians, including 64 children and 57 women, and injuries to over 698 others, according to the Gaza Health Ministry. The IDF reported fewer than 100 Palestinian casualties. The article also mentions that the Al-Qassam Brigades claimed that three Israeli hostages were killed during the raid. <image:63> is not mentioned in the article.

_________________________

* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)

* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

## Web Sources
**Web Search Result**

From [Source](https://countercurrents.org/2024/07/israel-bombs-un-school-in-nuseirat/): 
Content: The article from Countercurrents.org, published on July 7, 2024, reports that Israel bombed the Al Jaoni School in the Nuseirat refugee camp on July 6, 2024. The school was sheltering displaced Palestinians. The article mentions that Mayar Haidar (9 years old) and Bilal Hamida (6 years old) were killed in the bombing, along with their mother and grandmother. <image:63> The article also includes images from social media.


From [Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nuseirat_rescue_and_massacre): 
Content: The Wikipedia article "Nuseirat rescue and massacre" discusses an Israeli military operation on June 8, 2024, in the Nuseirat refugee camp in Gaza. The operation aimed to rescue Israeli hostages and resulted in the deaths of at least 276 Palestinians, including 64 children and 57 women, and injuries to over 698 others, according to the Gaza Health Ministry. The IDF reported fewer than 100 Palestinian casualties. The article also mentions that the Al-Qassam Brigades claimed that three Israeli hostages were killed during the raid. <image:63> is not mentioned in the article.


From [Source](https://www.aljazeera.com/podcasts/2024/6/11/the-take-aftermath-of-israels-raid-on-nuseirat-refugee-camp): 
Content: Al Jazeera published an article on June 11, 2024, discussing an Israeli raid on the Nuseirat camp in central Gaza. The raid resulted in the rescue of four captives and the killing of hundreds of Palestinians. <image:1>. The article mentions the Al-Aqsa Hospital.


## Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The article from Countercurrents.org ([https://countercurrents.org/2024/07/israel-bombs-un-school-in-nuseirat/](https://countercurrents.org/2024/07/israel-bombs-un-school-in-nuseirat/)) reports that Israel bombed the Al Jaoni School in the Nuseirat refugee camp on July 6, 2024, killing Mayar Haidar (9 years old) and Bilal Hamida (6 years old), along with their mother and grandmother. <image:63>
The Wikipedia article "Nuseirat rescue and massacre" ([https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nuseirat_rescue_and_massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nuseirat_rescue_and_massacre)) discusses an Israeli military operation on June 8, 2024, in the Nuseirat refugee camp, which resulted in the deaths of at least 276 Palestinians. Al Jazeera published an article on June 11, 2024, discussing an Israeli raid on the Nuseirat camp ([https://www.aljazeera.com/podcasts/2024/6/11/the-take-aftermath-of-israels-raid-on-nuseirat-refugee-camp](https://www.aljazeera.com/podcasts/2024/6/11/the-take-aftermath-of-israels-raid-on-nuseirat-refugee-camp)).

â€œWe condemn the Israeli occupation \[for\] committing these ongoing crimes and massacres against civilians, children and women,â€ it said.

The Nuseirat facility, run by the UN agency for Palestinian refugees (UNRWA), is [the latest school to be bombed](/news/2024/1/24/how-israel-has-destroyed-gazas-schools-and-universities)
 by the Israeli military since the Gaza war began in early October.

At least 38,098 Palestinians have been killed in Israeli attacks across Gaza since October 7 and the besieged enclave faces dire shortages of food, water, medicine and other humanitarian supplies.

On Saturday, dozens of Palestinians, [including five journalists](/news/2024/7/6/five-journalists-killed-as-israel-steps-up-bombardment-across-gaza)
, were killed as the Israeli military stepped up its bombardment of the territory.

Videos taken at the scene of the attack on the UNRWA school-turned-shelter in Nuseirat showed twisted metal at the collapsed building. Emergency workers also tried to cover two bodies as they were quickly brought into the medical complex.

The Palestinian Ministry of Health in Gaza said in a statement that 50 injured Palestinians were taken to the hospital.

In a [statement](https://x.com/IDF/status/1809662855660360020)
 shared on social media on Saturday night, the Israeli army said its air force â€œstruck several terroristsâ€ in the area of al-Jaouni school.

Reporting from Deir el-Balah, Al Jazeeraâ€™s Hind Khoudary said hundreds of Palestinian families had sought shelter at the school after they were forced to flee Israelâ€™s bombardment in other parts of Gaza.

The families â€œchose the middle area \[of the Gaza Strip\] because Israeli forces said the middle area is a safe zoneâ€, Khoudary said.

â€œEveryone in the Gaza Strip believes that they are not safe, wherever they go.â€

Last month, an Israeli attack on an UN-linked school â€“ also in Nuseirat refugee camp â€“ [killed at least 40 people](/news/2024/6/6/israel-bombs-unrwa-school-in-gaza-kills-32-displaced-palestinians)
 and injured dozens more, according to local authorities.

Musab, a 17-year-old survivor of the early June bombing of the UNRWA Nuseirat Boysâ€™ Preparatory School, told the UN agency that his father was killed after â€œmissiles rained downâ€ on the family.

â€œConcrete slabs fell on us, and suddenly, we found ourselves surrounded by the dead and injured. All of my family members were either injured or killed,â€ [Musab said](https://www.unrwa.org/newsroom/features/no-shelter-war-bombing-block-2-unrwa-nuseirat-school)
 in testimony shared by UNRWA.

â€œWe were sleeping, and at two in the morning, missiles rained down on us. A young boy could be seen sifting through pools of blood on the ground.

Footage shot at Al-Aqsa Martyrs Hospital in nearby Deir el-Balah and verified by Al Jazeeraâ€™s Sanad agency also showed children and young people being rushed from ambulances.

They included a girl with a bandaged arm, another with a bloodied face and a boy bandage across his head. They pulled us from under the rubble, and all we saw were shrapnel, debris, and dust. How will we live?â€

Source: Al Jazeera

Israeli air strike on Gaza school kills at least 16
===================================================

6 July 2024

ShareSave

Rushdi Aboualouf and Tom McArthur

BBC News

ShareSave

Shock and horror at scene of Gaza blast

**At least 16 people have been killed in an Israeli air strike on a UN-run school in the Gaza Strip, Palestinian officials have said. Dozens more have been injured.**

The building was sheltering thousands of displaced people at Nuseirat refugee camp in central Gaza, according to the Hamas-run health ministry.

Israel said it had struck several Hamas â€œterrorists operating in structures located in the area of Al-Jaouni Schoolâ€.

A local source said the target was a room allegedly used by Hamas police. A spokeswoman for the UN agency for Palestinian refugees (Unrwa) said the claims were "very, very serious" and should be investigated.

The attack comes as [hopes rise that a deal between Israel and Hamas is on the horizon](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/articles/c3gvp5q9y2go)
, following months of false starts.

Israel has announced it will send a team of negotiators next week to discuss a hostage release deal with Hamas.

It comes after a senior US administration official said Hamas had agreed to "pretty significant adjustments" to its position regarding a potential ceasefire.

A senior Hamas source told the Reuters news agency on Saturday that the group had agreed to begin talks on releasing Israeli hostages 16 days after the proposed first phase of an agreement aimed at ending the Gaza war.

Video from the scene of the Nuseirat school strike shows adults and children screaming in a smoke-filled street covered in dust and rubble, as they run to help the wounded.

Eyewitnesses told the BBC that the attack targeted the upper floors of the school, which is located near a busy market.

The BBC understands that up to 7,000 people were using the building as shelter.

One woman told the AFP news agency how some children were killed as they were reading the Koran when the building was hit.

"This is the fourth time they have targeted the school without warning," she said.

Hamas said five local journalists were among those killed in Israeli attacks on Saturday. Many were women and children."

She added it was not the first time Israel had made such claims, and that they should be investigated.

A previous attack in June on another packed UN-run school in Nuseirat [killed at least 35 people](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/articles/crggq0jygq6o)
.

Local journalists told the BBC at the time that a warplane fired two missiles at classrooms on the top floor of the school.

After that attack, Israelâ€™s military said it had â€œconducted a precise strike on a Hamas compoundâ€ in the school and killed many of the 20 to 30 fighters it believed were inside.

The head of the Unrwa described the June incident as "horrific" and said the claim that armed groups might have been inside a shelter was "shocking" but could not be confirmed.

Israelâ€™s war was triggered by Hamas's unprecedented attack on Israel on 7 October in which Hamas-led gunmen killed about 1,200 people and took 251 others back to Gaza as hostages.

At least 38,098 Palestinians have been killed in Gaza as a result of Israel's offensive, according to the territory's Hamas-run health ministry.

Israel has regularly accused Unrwa of supporting Hamas, which is proscribed as a terrorist organisation by Israel, the UK, US and other countries.

The organisation has rejected this.

In April, a UN investigation found Israel had failed to back up a claim that many of the agency's staff belonged militant groups, but also said it could improve its neutrality, staff vetting and transparency.

At least 50 people were injured in the strike, Gaza officials say.

In a statement, the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) confirmed it had hit the school buildings, saying it had taken "numerous steps" to "mitigate the risk of harming civilians, including the use of precise aerial surveillance and additional intelligence".

Hamas militants were using the location as a "hideout" to carry out attacks against IDF troops, it said.

"Hamas continues to systematically violate international law by exploiting civilian structures and the civilian population as human shields for its terrorist attacks against the State of Israel," it added.

Hamas called the attack a â€œmassacreâ€ on â€œdefenceless displaced civiliansâ€.

Many of the dead and wounded were women, children and the elderly, the group claimed via its English language Telegram channel.

! <image:2687>Reuters

The IDF said it was "looking into the details" of the incident.

Many schools and other UN facilities have been used as shelters by the 1.7 million people who have fled their homes during the war, which has lasted almost eight months.

"We donâ€™t have all the information yet. <image:2684>!Reuters People walk through the ruins of a school that was hit by an airstrike, killing at least 16 people. Since the war began, we have had more than half of our facilities hit," Juliette Touma, Unrwa's communications director, told the BBC regarding the latest attack.

"Many of them were shelters, and as a result at least 500 people sheltering in those facilities have been killed. Members of their family were also reportedly targeted.

More than 100 journalists have lost their lives in Gaza since the 7 October attacks, according to Reporters Without Borders.

Hamas said the five latest fatalities brings the number to 158.

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

## Claim

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The article from Countercurrents.org ([https://countercurrents.org/2024/07/israel-bombs-un-school-in-nuseirat/](https://countercurrents.org/2024/07/israel-bombs-un-school-in-nuseirat/)) reports that Israel bombed the Al Jaoni School in the Nuseirat refugee camp on July 6, 2024, killing Mayar Haidar (9 years old) and Bilal Hamida (6 years old), along with their mother and grandmother. <image:63>
The Wikipedia article "Nuseirat rescue and massacre" ([https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nuseirat_rescue_and_massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nuseirat_rescue_and_massacre)) discusses an Israeli military operation on June 8, 2024, in the Nuseirat refugee camp, which resulted in the deaths of at least 276 Palestinians. Al Jazeera published an article on June 11, 2024, discussing an Israeli raid on the Nuseirat camp ([https://www.aljazeera.com/podcasts/2024/6/11/the-take-aftermath-of-israels-raid-on-nuseirat-refugee-camp](https://www.aljazeera.com/podcasts/2024/6/11/the-take-aftermath-of-israels-raid-on-nuseirat-refugee-camp)).


### Evidence from `web_search`
Al Jazeera ([https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/7/6/israeli-attack-on-un-school-used-as-shelter-in-gaza-kills-at-least-16](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/7/6/israeli-attack-on-un-school-used-as-shelter-in-gaza-kills-at-least-16)) and BBC News ([https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c4ng04kpv2do](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c4ng04kpv2do)) reported on an Israeli attack on a UN-run school in the Nuseirat refugee camp on July 6, 2024, which resulted in at least 16 deaths. The school was sheltering displaced people. Israel stated it had struck Hamas "terrorists" operating in the area.

OPB ([https://www.opb.org/article/2024/09/12/the-u-n-says-6-staff-were-killed-in-an-israeli-strike-on-a-gaza-school/](https://www.opb.org/article/2024/09/12/the-u-n-says-6-staff-were-killed-in-an-israeli-strike-on-a-gaza-school/)) reported on an Israeli airstrike on a school sheltering families in the Nuseirat Refugee Camp in Gaza, which resulted in the death of six UN employees. The article mentions a previous Israeli attack on the Al-Jaouni school compound in July, where sixteen people were reported killed. <image:1>, <image:2684>, <image:2685>, <image:2687>, <image:2688>


# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The claim is supported by the evidence. Multiple sources confirm that an Israeli attack on a UN-run school in the Nuseirat refugee camp on July 6, 2024, resulted in casualties. One source specifically mentions the deaths of Mayar Haidar (9 years old) and Bilal Hamida (6 years old), along with their mother and grandmother.

JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.

## Claim
Claim: "<image:63> This image shows Mayar Hamida (9 years old) and Bilal Hamida (6 years old) who were killed by Israel along with their mother and grandmother at Al-Jaoni UN school in Al-Nuseirat refugee camp on July, 6 2024."

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The article from Countercurrents.org ([https://countercurrents.org/2024/07/israel-bombs-un-school-in-nuseirat/](https://countercurrents.org/2024/07/israel-bombs-un-school-in-nuseirat/)) reports that Israel bombed the Al Jaoni School in the Nuseirat refugee camp on July 6, 2024, killing Mayar Haidar (9 years old) and Bilal Hamida (6 years old), along with their mother and grandmother. <image:63>
The Wikipedia article "Nuseirat rescue and massacre" ([https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nuseirat_rescue_and_massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nuseirat_rescue_and_massacre)) discusses an Israeli military operation on June 8, 2024, in the Nuseirat refugee camp, which resulted in the deaths of at least 276 Palestinians. Al Jazeera published an article on June 11, 2024, discussing an Israeli raid on the Nuseirat camp ([https://www.aljazeera.com/podcasts/2024/6/11/the-take-aftermath-of-israels-raid-on-nuseirat-refugee-camp](https://www.aljazeera.com/podcasts/2024/6/11/the-take-aftermath-of-israels-raid-on-nuseirat-refugee-camp)).

The school was sheltering displaced people. Israel stated it had struck Hamas "terrorists" operating in the area.

OPB ([https://www.opb.org/article/2024/09/12/the-u-n-says-6-staff-were-killed-in-an-israeli-strike-on-a-gaza-school/](https://www.opb.org/article/2024/09/12/the-u-n-says-6-staff-were-killed-in-an-israeli-strike-on-a-gaza-school/)) reported on an Israeli airstrike on a school sheltering families in the Nuseirat Refugee Camp in Gaza, which resulted in the death of six UN employees. The article mentions a previous Israeli attack on the Al-Jaouni school compound in July, where sixteen people were reported killed. <image:1>, <image:2684>, <image:2685>, <image:2687>, <image:2688>


## Elaboration

One source specifically mentions the deaths of Mayar Haidar (9 years old) and Bilal Hamida (6 years old), along with their mother and grandmother.


# Your Judgement



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The claim is supported by multiple sources. The evidence confirms that an Israeli attack on a UN-run school in the Nuseirat refugee camp on July 6, 2024, resulted in casualties, including the children mentioned in the claim. `true`

SummarizeDocPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You are provided with the record of a fact-check. It contains the Claim to be verified and a documentation of all the fact-checking work along the gathered evidence. Your task is to **summarize the fact-check**. That is, you provide a concise, one-paragraph justification for the final VERDICT based on the knowledge from the Record. Note:
* Be truthful, brief, do not add any additional information besides the information given in the Record. 
* Link key sources in your summary. Use Markdown notation for that. You may link them in-line.
* Don't state the Claim again. Rather focus on the key insights of the fact-check.
* Simply print just the summary.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:63> This image shows Mayar Hamida (9 years old) and Bilal Hamida (6 years old) who were killed by Israel along with their mother and grandmother at Al-Jaoni UN school in Al-Nuseirat refugee camp on July, 6 2024."

The article from Countercurrents.org ([https://countercurrents.org/2024/07/israel-bombs-un-school-in-nuseirat/](https://countercurrents.org/2024/07/israel-bombs-un-school-in-nuseirat/)) reports that Israel bombed the Al Jaoni School in the Nuseirat refugee camp on July 6, 2024, killing Mayar Haidar (9 years old) and Bilal Hamida (6 years old), along with their mother and grandmother. <image:63>
